resources.string:
The syntax for rolls is as such: type '#d#' for a simple roll where the first # is the number of a dice and the second is the number of sides, i.e. '3d6' rolls 3 six sided dice. 
 Roll more than one different die on a single roll use '#d# + #d#' where there is a space either side of the plus or minus. 
 The #d# can be followed by a set of modifiers in the form of a string of varying length. No space between the second # and the modifiers. 
 
 • H or h - will keep the top value of all the dice rolls. 
 
 • L or l - will keep lowest value of the roll, removing all other rolls. 
 
 • D# or d# - will keep the # lowest values from the roll removing the others. 
 
 • K# or k# - will keep the # highest values from the roll. 
 
 • ># - will return the number of die values above #. 
 
 • <# will return the number of die values below #. 
 
 • +# or -# - will add/subtract # to the value
